overview:
Implementation of a 32x32 matrix multiplication followed by a matrix addition using 4-byte float values. Executes both matrix mult and add in software, then in hardware, and verifies the result. By default the functions 'mmult()' and 'madd()' are marked for hardware, and you can build the project. SDSoC pragmas are used to specify sequential access for 'mmult()' function resulting in FIFO interfaces. No pragmas are specified for 'madd()' function resulting in default BRAM interfaces.
NOTE: You must specify the Linux Root File System as <Platform Location>/sw/sysroot for this demo to work. You must also have run "export SYSROOT=<Platform Location>/sw/sysroot" from the command line prior to launching sdx
